You know what is really trash. The ranked system in general. It's probably only accurate at Platinum and up. I feel like in all honest Gold is there to say hey you survived the toxic people and climbed your way with luck into people who understand the game and don't necessarily mimic the pros every single game. I struggle to climb to Gold in this game not due to my own skill, but due to the enemy team being too fed half the time. In HotS I am at about rank 14. Which is top 38% with a 17/10 win loss in a game with less carrying. And I can't even get past top 50% in League lol.

Me and my friend duo'd and we could smash teams 2v5 in silver but you get that one guy who doesn't know when to admit they are unable to win their lane and feed the hell out of them and it ruins the climb. I usually try and say hey "This match up may be rough, I may need help" or ask for help. The only time I get mad is when the team seems to ignore you when you ask for help and you then start to feed because you know you can't win and are just trying to contribute and your team won't bail you out then complain.

surely you realize that while HotS and LoL are both MOBAs, LoL is radically different because of the fact that there's a lot more individualism involved. it's hard to make a rational comparison between the two ranked systems because you literally level up as a team in HotS and there's no real concept of "getting fed" for just one person

The point is I have managed to carry and the team stays more level headed in a game where no one person is at fault for everything. In Hots one or 2 kills to any person doesn't put the enemy team ahead. But in League that's almost GG if the person abuses their lead. The point is in HotS your teammates mistakes early game (unless its something that just keeps repeating) don't effect you as badly as in League even though its more of a team game.

The point is in HotS your teammates mistakes early game (unless its something that just keeps repeating) don't effect you as badly as in League even though its more of a team game.

it's arguably easier keep everyone on the same page when there are fewer individual stats to worry about. CSing, warding, itemization -- none of these exist in HotS. it's definitely a less frustrating model to deal with because there are fewer windows of opportunity to punish mistakes.

but at the same time, if someone manages to establish and maintain a lead over their opponent(s), do they not deserve to win and rise in the ranks? it feels great to have a huge impact on the outcome of your games, after all. as far as the struggle with silver goes, just remember that the dead weight will sometimes be on the enemy team as well. if you play to the best of your ability and continue to improve, you will climb regardless of who's on your team. i don't think the ranked system is problematic here outside of how promos work, tbh

You'll find people in master who afk and troll.  I remember a while back wings had an afk annie on his team (purposely ruining his game, not emergency IRL) and he was pretty salty about it, which is normal.  When you climb to the top and find out it still contains the shit that's in the bottom of the barrel you're bound to be pretty mad.

Does it even matter? If this game tanked, would that rank mean anything? When you reached the Gold division, have you been able to take that to a company, a manager, or someone who is hiring people for work and be able to say you qualify for that specific job because you're able to reach some random division in a game?

On to the less drastic/radical point of view-
Sure, ranks **can** mean something. Our ranking system is not entirely perfect, but it still does it's job.  If you're gold you probably do have a better understanding of the game than those in lower divisions.

I personally find it to be pretty pathetic to flaunt around how "good" you are based off of what division you're in. To be a blatant shitter about what division you're in and how much better you are than everyone else makes you look like a maximum asshat.
